title: Is war a rational act of state policy in the light of wars fought in the 20th century? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on the circumstances. Sometimes war can be the only effective means of avoiding greater harm or avoiding some other outcome which from that particular government’s perspective would be worse. If you look at it in those terms then sometimes the decision of a country to go to war can in fact be entirely rational it basically depends on the circumstances and what that nation’s government is seeking to either achieve or avoid.
